topic.title: How to Install Feedback Enterprise Service on Linux

ul.li: Google Chrome 78.0 [recommended for optimal performance and user experience]

p.note: It is recommended to create a dedicated user to configure and run the service.

ol.li:
Create an installation directory, then download and unzip the Feedback installation package there.
Sample code to create the install directory: sudo mkdir /home/feedback/oxygen-feedback sudo chown feedback: /home/feedback/oxygen-feedback
Sample code to extract the archive content: cd /home/feedback/oxygen-feedback unzip oxygen-feedback-{version}-SNAPSHOT-package-enterprise.zip

[Optional] [Recommended] Create an application home directory. By default, the Feedback home directory value is the installation directory, but if you want to define a custom value, you can add the custom path to feedback-home.properties or pass it via the -Dfeedback.home= JVM argument.The structure of the home folder should contain the config and data directories.
The home directory is used to store configuration files and application data (such as images for avatars and logos). It is recommended to be set to separate application files by the data files.
Sample code to create a home directory: sudo mkdir /home/feedback/oxygen-feedback-home sudo chown feedback: /home/feedback/oxygen-feedback-home

Set service port. By default, the service uses the port 8080. To change the port that the service runs on, open {Installation-Directory}/config/feedback-server.properties and set the http.port property to your desired value.
For example: http.port=8081
Set up the database. For detailed instructions, see: .
Set up the license for Feedback Enterprise.

Set up the application properties by opening {Installation-Directory}/config/feedback-application.properties and setting the following:
Application Host URL
The server URL where the application will be deployed. It must contain the protocol and port and it will be used in the email notifications: feedback.server.host.url= http://example.com
Image Upload Configuration
Image upload allowed extensions: feedback.upload.extensions= jpg, jpeg, png, gif
Set it to true for images to be validated before being uploaded or false to not validate them. feedback.image.validation= true
Sets the maximum allowed size of an image in KB. feedback.max.file.upload.size= 2048
Comment Configuration
Sets the limit of how many characters a comment can have. feedback.max.comment.character.size= 10000
Sets the number of days that a deleted comment can be restored. After that, the comment is permanently deleted. feedback.comment.expiration.period= 30
Accounts Management Configuration
Sets the number of hours that a newly created account can be activated before it expires. feedback.account.expiration.period= 24
Sets the number of days that a deleted account can be recovered. feedback.account.termination.period= 14
Role Change Settings
Sets the number of hours that a site ownership transfer is valid. If the transfer is not accepted within that time, it will automatically be cancelled: feedback.valid.transfer.site.ownership.period= 24
Sets the number of days that a role change is pending. If not accepted within that time, it will automatically be cancelled. feedback.valid.role.change.period= 1

Set up email notifications ( requires an email server to send account confirmation emails, password reset emails, or comment activity emails. Open {Installation-Directory}/config/feedback-mail.properties and set the following:
Configure the SMTP Outgoing Server
The SMTP name: spring.mail.host= smtp.example.com
The SMTP port: spring.mail.port= 25
Configure the From Email Address
The name that will be displayed in the From field for email messages sent by this server: feedback.email.sender= company@sender.example.com
Configure SMTP Authentication
The username used in the authenticated SMTP: spring.mail.username= sa
The password used in the authenticated SMTP: spring.mail.password=
Configure STARTTLS Protocol Command
If true, it enables the use of the STARTTLS command (if supported by the server) to switch the connection to a TLS-protected connection before issuing any login commands. If the server does not support STARTTLS, the connection continues without the use of TLS: spring.mail.properties.mail.smtp.starttls.enable= true
If true, it requires the use of the STARTTLS command. If the server does not support the STARTTLS command, or the command fails, the connect method will fail. The default is false. spring.mail.properties.mail.smtp.starttls.required= false
Configure SSL Authentication
If set to true, it uses SSL to connect and uses the SSL port by default. The default is false for the SMTP protocol and true for the SMTPS protocol: spring.mail.properties.mail.smtp.ssl.enable= true
Specifies the port to connect to when using the specified socket factory. If not set, the default port will be used. spring.mail.properties.mail.smtp.ssl.socketFactory.port= 465
Advanced Properties
The default message encoding: spring.mail.default-encoding= UTF-8
uses JavaMail for sending emails and it allows additional properties to be set using the following pattern: spring.mail.properties.{JAVA.MAIL.PROPERTY}=
See all available properties in the JavaMail documentation at: .spring.mail.properties.*=
Start as a Linux Service. For detailed instructions, see .

Create your first administrator account:
Go to the location where the Feedback server is deployed (e.g. http://localhost:8080).
In the resulting setup page, define your first platform admin.
Enter the required information and click the Create button. The setup page is only visible the first time the application is started. After the first platform admin is defined, that page will no longer be available.
